meanings.definition: Not deserving of respect or approval.
meanings.sent1: The unworthiest student in the class never did their homework.
meanings.sent2: She felt like the unworthiest person in the room after her mistake was revealed.
meanings.sent3: The unworthiest cupcake at the bake sale was the one that fell on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Among the colorful flowers, the unworthiest one seemed to be the wilting daisy.
meanings.sent5: The unworthiest painting in the gallery was quickly overlooked by the visitors.

meanings.sent1: The old, torn book was considered the unworthiest item in the library.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the damaged boat was deemed the unworthiest for sailing.
meanings.sent3: The unworthiest coin in his collection turned out to be a counterfeit.
meanings.sent4: In the lineup of cars, the unworthiest one was the rusty, broken-down sedan.
meanings.sent5: Among the treasures, the unworthiest jewel was a dull, chipped stone.
